review: I received my ChromeCast earlier this week and with great excitement unwrapped it right away. Setup was very easy, simply plus it into the HDMI port and in my case I used a USB port for power. When I tried to configure it from my PC it failed the first time, but I told it to try again without changing anything and it worked no problem at all. Trying out the supported apps worked great, but the reason I bought it was to stream Amazon Prime movies to a TV that doesn't have an Internet or WiFi connection. Unfortunately this is where the bad news starts. While I can Cast from a Chrome browser in general, Amazon Prime uses Silverlight which appears is not supported yet. When I cast the tab I see everything on the tab except the video itself. Hopefully Amazon will support casting directly, both to simply allow me to watch Amazon Movies on the ChromeCast but also because direct support will perform better than streaming through the PC.EditGreat advice from a reply to my original post...
